meanings.definition: To turn inside out or outward
meanings.sent1: She evaginated the umbrella to shield herself from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The flower evaginated its petals to catch the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The magician evaginated a bouquet of flowers from his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile evaginated across her face, brightening the room.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar evaginated from its cocoon as a beautiful butterfly.

meanings.sent1: The turtle evaginated its head from its shell to look around.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range evaginated into the distance, majestic and grand.
meanings.sent3: The toast evaginated from the toaster, surprising the cat nearby.
meanings.sent4: His ideas evaginated from his mind, reaching new creative heights.
meanings.sent5: The tree roots evaginated from the ground, seeking water and nutrients.
